channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Walmart is determined to win the Thanksgiving meal value wars with a $40 dinner for 10 people
item.description: The Butterball turkey is at its lowest price since 2019, Walmart U.S. president and CEO John Furner said.

item.title: Hawley vows to hold Democrats' 'feet to the fire' with new government shutdown funding bills
item.description: Sen. Josh Hawley, R-Mo., is introducing legislation to fund Farm Service Agency and SNAP programs amid the government shutdown.

item.title: Nuking the Filibuster Would Be Political Folly
item.description: There’s no good reason to hand Democrats such a strategic and tactical win amid the shutdown.

item.title: Coast Guard surges to Rio Grande in new border security mission, Operation River Wall

item.title: Apple is ‘drastically’ cutting iPhone Air production, report says, after new survey reveals ‘virtually no demand’

item.title: Hegseth changes policy on how Pentagon officials communicate with Congress
item.description: Leaders at the Pentagon have significantly altered how military officials will speak with Congress after a pair of new memos issued last week.

item.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella’s pay hits a record $96.5 million—he got a 22% pay rise mirroring the $4 trillion tech giant’s skyrocketing shares
item.description: Satya Nadella’s pay hits its highest since becoming Microsoft CEO, driven by a 23% stock surge in 2025 and shares doubling in three years.
